OUR EARLY DREAMERS

HELP US FIND THE UNSUNG HEROES OF YOUR FAMILY

TELL YOUR STORY

Our parents and grandparents are so humble. They don’t think of themselves as heroes. Yet over their lifetimes, while achieving their own dreams and aspirations — they’ve each played an important role in building our nation. Both local Emiratis as well as people who came here from other nations and stayed to build alongside us — each person has helped build our nation in their own unique way.

Early dreamers of our nation

FATIMA AL ZAROONI

Story shared by Mohammed Noor Al Anoohi

My mother, Fatima Al Zarooni, sewed this “kandora” for me when I was a newborn. She learned to sew soon after sewing machines were imported to Abu Dhabi. She enjoyed it so much that she set up a small sewing room in our house.

Read story

Share your story

Help us to find early dreamers within your family and upload your story. You can start it right away!

1. Start a conversation.

2. Reflect on what you learned.

3. Write and upload your story.

Gather with your parents and grandparents. Get comfortable and start the conversation:

Ask them about their childhood, their dreams and worries at the time; About their aspirations and inspiring figures or moments; About their expectations for the future of the nation…

For further inspiration download our Conversation Kit.

Reflect on what you learned.

What’s something you learned that you didn’t know before?

What did you find most surprising or unexpected?

Note your thoughts and include them in your story.

Great! Now share with us what you’ve learned:

Firstly, from whom is your story about?

What is his/her name?

Tell us about him/her:

Share their passions, achievements and contributions to your family, community and/or nation.

What have you learned from this person?

Why are you proud or inspired by this person?
